value.title: Power BI PowerShell and the Admin API
value.excerpt: The Power BI PowerShell and the Admin API allow you to quickly inventory your organization and manage workspaces and access. Forget the hastle of setting up the App registration within Azure Active Directory for API access, the Power BI PowerShell cmdlets take care of it for you. Just install and start

value.title: Power BI reports for consumers (end users)
value.excerpt: Adam walks through how to navigate and use Power BI reports for consumers, or end users. This is geared towards someone not really familiar with the Power BI interface or how to use Power BI reports to their fullest.  ******** LET'S CONNECT! ********  -- http://twitter.com/guyinacube -- http://twitter.com/awsaxton

value.title: Power BI XMLA Endpoint: Why you should care
value.excerpt: The XMLA Endpoint in Power BI can be very powerful. Adam looks at what it is and how to get started with it. If you are using Power BI Premium or Premium Per User, you need to know about this!  Live Stream Question: https://youtu.be/_SLFZiA3peU?t=1229  XMLA Endpoint Documentation: https://docs.microsoft.com/power-bi/admin/service-premium-connect-tools

value.title: Preventing Data Silos with Power BI
value.excerpt: In this video, Patrick and Kalyn look at data silos and how to prevent it using Power BI. Different options exist, such as Analysis Services, Azure Analysis Services or models hosted in the Power BI service.  LET'S CONNECT!  Guy in a Cube -- https://guyinacube.com -- http://twitter.com/guyinacube --

value.title: Tools to take Power BI to the NEXT LEVEL

value.title: Using DAX to format a list of values in Power BI Desktop

Original Quick Measure video - https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=SjSKCZtiNlI  Alberto's article - https://www.sqlbi.com/blog/alberto/2018/12/20/displaying-a-list-of-selected-months/

value.title: Using different languages with the Power BI site
value.excerpt: I look at how your browser languages affect what is displayed. This all comes down to your browsers and the language settings within. Different browsers are configured differently. Fiddler can show you what your language order is.  SUBSCRIBE! https://www.youtube.com/channel/UCFp1vaKzpfvoGai0vE5VJ0w?sub_confirmation=1

value.title: What are Power BI data connectors and why should you care?
value.excerpt: You need a connector to work with data in Power Query for Power BI or Excel. But what is a connector? Adam explains what these are and how to find out what's available.  Power Query Connectors: https://docs.microsoft.com/power-query/connectors/  Power BI data sources: https://docs.microsoft.com/power-bi/connect-data/power-bi-data-sources
